4.2 Heat Treatment:
4.2.1 All pipe shall be furnished in the heat-treated condi­
tion. The heat-treatment procedure

column3: shall consist of heating the pipe

column1: to a minimum temperature of 1900 °P [1040 °C] and quench­
ing in water or rapidly cooling by other means.
4.2.2 All H grades and S30815 shall be furnished in the
solution-treated condition. The minimum solution treating
temperature for Grades TP321H
be 2000 °P [1100 °C] and for Grades TP304H and TP316H
1900 °P [1040 °C]. The minimum temperature for S30815
shall be 1920 °P [1050 °C].
4.2.3 The heat-treatment procedure for S31254 shall consist
of heating the pipe to a minimum temperature of 2100 °P [1150
0 C] and quenching in water or rapidly cooling by other means.
4.2.4 The heat-treatment procedure for S31727 and S32053
shall consist of heating the pipe to a minimum temperature of
1975 to 2155 °P [1080 to 1180 °C] and quenching in water or
rapidly cooling by other means.
4.2.5 UNS N08367 shall be solution annealed from 2025 °P
[1110 °C] minimum followed by rapid quenching.
